name: R5-SubstanceDefinition-R4B-SubstanceDefinition
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 SubstanceDefinition into FHIR R4B

element.display: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing

target.display: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing
target.comment: R5 `SubstanceDefinition` maps as Equivalent to R4B `SubstanceDefinition`

element.display: General specifications for this substance
The description or justification in support of the interpretation of the data file
Additional content defined by implementations
The data produced by the analytical instrument or a pictorial representation of that data. Examples: a JCAMP, JDX, or ADX file, or a chromatogram or spectrum analysis
Describes the nature of the chemical entity and explains, for instance, whether this is a base or a salt form
Unique id for inter-element referencing
Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
The method used to find the characterization e.g. HPLC
A categorization, high level e.g. polymer or nucleic acid, or food, chemical, biological, or lower e.g. polymer linear or branch chain, or type of impurity

target.display: A categorization, high level e.g. polymer or nucleic acid, or food, chemical, biological, or lower e.g. polymer linear or branch chain, or type of impurity
target.comment: R5 `SubstanceDefinition.classification` maps as Equivalent to R4B `SubstanceDefinition.classification`

target.display: Codes associated with the substance
target.comment: R5 `SubstanceDefinition.code` maps as Equivalent to R4B `SubstanceDefinition.code`

target.display: Additional content defined by implementations

target.display: Unique id for inter-element referencing
